description:
Version: Diablo (2011.3.1)

If there are no floating IPs, "nova-manage floating list" returns an error message:

# nova-manage floating list
Command failed, please check log for more info


Would improve usability if it returned a message that said "No floating IPs have been defined".
title: nova-manage floating list returns error if no floating IPs

comments.content:
Version: Diablo (2011.3.1)

If there are no floating IPs, "nova-manage floating list" returns an error message:

# nova-manage floating list
Command failed, please check log for more info


Would improve usability if it returned a message that said "No floating IPs have been defined".
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~lorinh

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/4214
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/4214
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/b01933a2dcb6386ed89684d319bbe6a964d30402
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit b01933a2dcb6386ed89684d319bbe6a964d30402
Author: Russell Bryant <email address hidden>
Date:   Wed Feb 15 17:08:36 2012 -0500

    Print friendly message if no floating IPs exist.
    
    Fix bug 932071.
    
    Print out a friendly message from nova-manage when the "floating list"
    command is issued but no floating IPs have been defined.  Prior to this
    change, a generic error message would be printed, pointing to the log
    for further details.
    
    Change-Id: I0d11f93e9f51cf4e99e319bc9296f73380564257
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
